definition: lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
branch/classifier for sticks, rods, pencils etc
alone/independent/single/sole/only
handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears

sentences.english: Hongkong Winling has dominated Hongkong basketball league for many years.
sentences.chinese: 多年来，永伦队在香港篮球联赛中一直是一枝独秀。

sentences.english: Bianliang Imperial College is a special branch in the central engraving institutions of Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 在宋代中央刻书机构中，汴梁国子监可谓是一枝独秀。

sentences.english: Apple lords over the high-end market.
sentences.chinese: 苹果目前在高端笔记本电脑市场一枝独秀。

sentences.english: Four Seasons care outshines all else in Alexandria.
sentences.chinese: 四季保健一枝独秀一切在亚历山德里亚。

definition: most outstanding/par excellence
to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
to take the lead in a race/to set the pace
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
a hundred flowers bloom (idiom); let the arts have free expression
to advance singing loudly (idiom); triumphant progress
top three
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
bellwether
great heroes pursue deer in the central plains (idiom); fig. many vie for supremacy
dark horse/fig. unexpected winner
half of the country (esp. when half the country has fallen into enemy hands)/vast swathe of territory
to be perched high/to be located prominently/to be preeminent
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
